thread.title: Park keeps giraffe birth cam going despite 'sexual' complaints
thread.title_full: Park keeps giraffe birth cam going despite 'sexual' complaints

author: BRIAN LISI
title: Park keeps giraffe birth cam going despite 'sexual' complaints
text:
SEE IT: New York animal park fights to keep giraffe birth cam going despite getting labeled 'sexually explicit' Park keeps giraffe birth cam going despite 'sexual' complaints Thursday, February 23, 2017, 1:00 PM 
Mind your mammals. 
Officials at animal park in southern New York aren't giving up on live streaming the birth of a baby giraffe after the video feed got momentarily shut down for being "sexually explicit," PIX11 reports. 
Blaming unnamed "animal rights extremists" in a Facebook Live video broadcast Thursday morning, Jordan Patch, owner of Animal Adventure Park in Harpursville, N.Y., said, "This is the perfect example of why we can't have nice things." 
According to Patch, millions of viewers were briefly prevented from watching April the giraffe give birth to her fourth calf because some users reported to YouTube that the footage was pornographic. 
SEE IT: Bald eagle parents say hello to New Year's Eve eaglet 
The park's first video feed was reportedly removed, while a second attempt was stopped. The third and most recent attempt has been operational since about 9 .a.m. Thursday. Animal Adventure Park owner Jordan Patch claims millions have been tuning in to YouTube to watch April give birth to her latest child. (Animal Adventure Park/Facebook) 
"Instead of sitting behind a keyboard or holding up protest sign, get behind conservation," said Patch, who held some produce for some reason while delivering his Facebook Live message. "We're all on the same team. We want the best for these animals, and we would love to have them in their natural environment one day, but until we can control the destruction of natural habitat and poaching, that is not going to happen." 
It's unclear why the park thinks activists in particular were responsible since, according to Google, "Flagging videos is anonymous, so other users can't tell who flagged a video." 
Patch also confirmed April is in no pain while adding they have no specific idea when it will give birth. Tags:
